RECAPTCHA.RECAPTCHA-IMAGE: Enter the words you read below

TOUR.WELCOME-CONTENT: This a short tour of the Alfresco Activiti Editor. The next few steps will guide you through the different sections of the application to get you started. Press the ESC key to stop at any time.
TOUR.PALETTE-CONTENT: All the available constructs to create a business process can be found here. They are arranged in logical groups. To open a group simply click on it:
TOUR.CANVAS-CONTENT: This is the work space on which you create your business process. Drag elements from the palette on the left and drop them on this canvas to start modeling.
TOUR.DRAGDROP-CONTENT: Here is an example how you get started with modeling:
TOUR.PROPERTIES-CONTENT: Here you can configure the properties of a business process construct. Simply select the item on the canvas and its properties will be shown. Click on the property if you want to edit it
TOUR.TOOLBAR-CONTENT: All the actions can be found here: saving or validating a model, copy and pasting parts of a process, and so on. Hover over the buttons to get a description for an action.
TOUR.END-CONTENT: That's it! You can now start modeling your processes. If you have any questions, feel free to ask them on the Alfresco Activiti Forum

BENDPOINT.TITLE: Bend point tutorial
BENDPOINT.DESCRIPTION:
When you are connecting process steps with each other using sequence flow (those arrows between process steps), you might find that these sequence flow cross each other or you would like to arrange them differently. To do this, you can add or remove a bend point to or from a sequence flow.

As shown below in the picture, you first click the 'add bendpoint' and then click on a sequence flow to add it. Note that the sequence flow will show you a subtle indication in green to show the bendpoint can be added there.

Removing a bendpoint again follows a similar pattern: click the 'remove bendpoint' button and click on the bend point to remove it again.

INVOLVE-PEOPLE.NO-MATCHING-RESULTS: Use the search box above to find users or
INVOLVE-PEOPLE.USE-EMAIL: select someone using an email address
INVOLVE-PEOPLE.EMAIL-HELP: Press Enter or click the button to continue. This person will be notified by email or invited to sign up

ASSOCIATION.TITLE: Association
ASSOCIATION.DESCRIPTION: Associates a text annotation with an element

BOUNDARY-ERROR-EVENT.TITLE: Boundary error event
BOUNDARY-ERROR-EVENT.DESCRIPTION: A boundary event that catches a BPMN error

BOUNDARY-MESSAGE-EVENT.TITLE: Boundary message event
BOUNDARY-MESSAGE-EVENT.DESCRIPTION: A boundary event with a message trigger

BOUNDARY-SIGNAL-EVENT.TITLE: Boundary signal event
BOUNDARY-SIGNAL-EVENT.DESCRIPTION: A boundary event with a signal trigger

BOUNDARY-TIMER-EVENT.TITLE: Boundary timer event
BOUNDARY-TIMER-EVENT.DESCRIPTION: A boundary event with a timer trigger

BUSINESSRULETASK.TITLE: Business rule task
BUSINESSRULETASK.DESCRIPTION: An automatic task with rule logic

CAMELTASK.TITLE: Camel task
CAMELTASK.DESCRIPTION: A task that sends a message to Camel

COLLAPSED-SUBPROCESS.TITLE: Collapsed sub process
COLLAPSED-SUBPROCESS.DESCRIPTION: Provide a reference to a reusable sub process definition

DATA-ASSOCIATION.TITLE: Data association
DATA-ASSOCIATION.DESCRIPTION: Associates a data element with an activity

END-ERROR-EVENT.TITLE: Error end event
END-ERROR-EVENT.DESCRIPTION: An end event that throws an error event

END-NONE-EVENT.TITLE: End event
END-NONE-EVENT.DESCRIPTION: An end event without a specific trigger

INTERMEDIATE-MESSAGE-CATCH-EVENT.TITLE: Intermediate message catching event
INTERMEDIATE-MESSAGE-CATCH-EVENT.DESCRIPTION: An intermediate catching event with a message trigger

INTERMEDIATE-SIGNAL-CATCH-EVENT.TITLE: Intermediate signal catching event
INTERMEDIATE-SIGNAL-CATCH-EVENT.DESCRIPTION: An intermediate catching event with a signal trigger

INTERMEDIATE-TIMER-CATCH-EVENT.TITLE: Intermediate timer catching event
INTERMEDIATE-TIMER-CATCH-EVENT.DESCRIPTION: An intermediate catching event with a timer trigger

INTERMEDIATE-NONE-THROW-EVENT.TITLE: Intermediate none throwing event
INTERMEDIATE-NONE-THROW-EVENT.DESCRIPTION: An intermediate event without a specific trigger

INTERMEDIATE-SIGNAL-THROW-EVENT.TITLE: Intermediate signal throwing event
INTERMEDIATE-SIGNAL-THROW-EVENT.DESCRIPTION: An intermediate event with a signal trigger

LANE.TITLE: Lane
LANE.DESCRIPTION: A lane to stucture the process definition

MANUALTASK.TITLE: Manual task
MANUALTASK.DESCRIPTION: An automatic task with no logic

MESSAGE-FLOW.TITLE: Message flow
MESSAGE-FLOW.DESCRIPTION: Message flow to connect elements in different pools

MULETASK.TITLE: Mule task
MULETASK.DESCRIPTION: A task that sends a message to Mule

POOL.TITLE: Pool
POOL.DESCRIPTION: A pool to stucture the process definition

RECEIVETASK.TITLE: Receive task
RECEIVETASK.DESCRIPTION: A task that waits for a signal

SCRIPTTASK.TITLE: Script task
SCRIPTTASK.DESCRIPTION: An automatic task with script logic

SERVICETASK.TITLE: Service task
SERVICETASK.DESCRIPTION: An automatic task with service logic

SENDTASK.TITLE: Send task
SENDTASK.DESCRIPTION: A task that sends a message

SEQUENCE-FLOW.TITLE: Sequence flow
SEQUENCE-FLOW.DESCRIPTION: Sequence flow defines the execution order of activities

START-ERROR-EVENT.TITLE: Start error event
START-ERROR-EVENT.DESCRIPTION: A start event that catches a thrown BPMN error

START-MESSAGE-EVENT.TITLE: Start message event
START-MESSAGE-EVENT.DESCRIPTION: A start event with a message trigger

START-NONE-EVENT.TITLE: Start event
START-NONE-EVENT.DESCRIPTION: 三生三世A start event without a specific trigger

START-SIGNAL-EVENT.TITLE: Start signal event
START-SIGNAL-EVENT.DESCRIPTION: A start event with a signal trigger

START-TIMER-EVENT.TITLE: Start timer event
START-TIMER-EVENT.DESCRIPTION: A start event with a timer trigger

USERTASK.TITLE: User task
USERTASK.DESCRIPTION: A manual task assigned to a specific person

CAMEL-CONTEXT.TITLE: Camel context
CAMEL-CONTEXT.DESCRIPTION: An optional camel context definition, if left empty the default is used.

COMPENSATION.TITLE: Is for compensation
COMPENSATION.DESCRIPTION: A flag that identifies whether this activity is intended for the purposes of compensation.

COLLAPSED-SUBPROCESS-REFERENCE.TITLE: Referenced Subprocess
COLLAPSED-SUBPROCESS-REFERENCE.DESCRIPTION: Reference to a subprocess that is included in the collapsed subprocess.

DOCUMENTATION.TITLE: Documentation
DOCUMENTATION.DESCRIPTION: The descriptive description of the BPMN element.

ENDPOINT-URL.TITLE: Endpoint url
ENDPOINT-URL.DESCRIPTION: A required endpoint url to sent the message to Mule.

EVENT-LISTENERS.TITLE: Event listeners
EVENT-LISTENERS.DESCRIPTION: Listeners for any event happening in the Activiti Engine. It's also possible to rethrow the event as a signal, message or error event.

EXECUTION-LISTENERS.TITLE: Execution listeners
EXECUTION-LISTENERS.DESCRIPTION: Listeners for an activity, process, sequence flow, start and end event.

FORM-KEY.TITLE: Form key
FORM-KEY.DESCRIPTION: Form key that provides a reference to a form.

FORM-PROPERTIES.TITLE: Form properties
FORM-PROPERTIES.DESCRIPTION: Definition of the form with a list of form properties.

MAILTASK-BCC.TITLE: Bcc
MAILTASK-BCC.DESCRIPTION: The bcc's of the e-mail. Multiple recipients are defined in a comma-separated list.

MAILTASK-CC.TITLE: Cc
MAILTASK-CC.DESCRIPTION: The cc's of the e-mail. Multiple recipients are defined in a comma-separated list.

MAILTASK-CHARSET.TITLE: Charset
MAILTASK-CHARSET.DESCRIPTION: Allows to change the charset of the email, which is necessary for many non-English languages.

MAILTASK-FROM.TITLE: From
MAILTASK-FROM.DESCRIPTION: The sender e-mail address. If not provided, the default configured from address is used.

MAILTASK-HTML.TITLE: Html
MAILTASK-HTML.DESCRIPTION: A piece of HTML that is the content of the e-mail.

MAILTASK-TEXT.TITLE: Text
MAILTASK-TEXT.DESCRIPTION: The content of the e-mail, in case one needs to send plain none-rich e-mails. Can be used in combination with html, for e-mail clients that don't support rich content. The client will then fall back to this text-only alternative.

MAILTASK-TO.TITLE: To
MAILTASK-TO.DESCRIPTION: The recipients if the e-mail. Multiple recipients are defined in a comma-separated list.

MULETASK-LANGUAGE.TITLE: Language
MULETASK-LANGUAGE.DESCRIPTION: A required definition for the language to resolve the payload expression, like juel.

MULETASK-PAYLOAD.TITLE: Payload expression
MULETASK-PAYLOAD.DESCRIPTION: A required definition for the payload of the message sent to Mule.

MULETASK-RESULT-VARIABLE.TITLE: Result variable
MULETASK-RESULT-VARIABLE.DESCRIPTION: An optional result variable for the payload returned.

MULTI-INSTANCE-CARDINALITY.TITLE: Cardinality (Multi-instance)
MULTI-INSTANCE-CARDINALITY.DESCRIPTION: Define the cardinality of multi instance.

MULTI-INSTANCE-COLLECTION.TITLE: Collection (Multi-instance)
MULTI-INSTANCE-COLLECTION.DESCRIPTION: Define the collection for the multi instance.

MULTI-INSTANCE-CONDITION.TITLE: Completion condition (Multi-instance)
MULTI-INSTANCE-CONDITION.DESCRIPTION: Define the completion condition for the multi instance.

MULTI-INSTANCE-TYPE.TITLE: Multi-instance type
MULTI-INSTANCE-TYPE.DESCRIPTION: Repeated activity execution (parallel or sequential) can be displayed through different loop types.

MULTI-INSTANCE-VARIABLE.TITLE: Element variable (Multi-instance)
MULTI-INSTANCE-VARIABLE.DESCRIPTION: Define the element variable for the multi instance.

NAME.TITLE: Name
NAME.DESCRIPTION: The descriptive name of the BPMN element.

PROCESS-ID.TITLE: Process identifier
PROCESS-ID.DESCRIPTION: Unique identifier of the process definition.

PROCESS-NAMESPACE.TITLE: Target namespace
PROCESS-NAMESPACE.DESCRIPTION: Target namespace for the process definition.

RULE-EXCLUDE.TITLE: Exclude
RULE-EXCLUDE.DESCRIPTION: Use the rules property as exclusion.

RULE-INPUT-VARIABLES.TITLE: Input variables
RULE-INPUT-VARIABLES.DESCRIPTION: Input variables of the rule task.

RULE-RESULT-VARIABLE.TITLE: Result variable
RULE-RESULT-VARIABLE.DESCRIPTION: Result variable of the rule task.

SCRIPTTASK-FORMAT.TITLE: Script format
SCRIPTTASK-FORMAT.DESCRIPTION: Script format of the script task.

SCRIPTTASK-TEXT.TITLE: Script
SCRIPTTASK-TEXT.DESCRIPTION: Script text of the script task.

SERVICETASK-CLASS.TITLE: Class
SERVICETASK-CLASS.DESCRIPTION: Class that implements the service task logic.

SERVICETASK-DELEGATE-EXPRESSION.TITLE: Delegate expression
SERVICETASK-DELEGATE-EXPRESSION.DESCRIPTION: Service task logic defined with a delegate expression.

SERVICETASK-EXPRESSION.TITLE: Expression
SERVICETASK-EXPRESSION.DESCRIPTION: Service task logic defined with an expression.

SERVICETASK-FIELDS.TITLE: Class fields
SERVICETASK-FIELDS.DESCRIPTION: Field extensions for a service task.

SERVICETASK-RESULT-VARIABLE.TITLE: Result variable name
SERVICETASK-RESULT-VARIABLE.DESCRIPTION: Process variable name to store the service task result.

SEQUENCE-FLOW-CONDITION.TITLE: Flow condition
SEQUENCE-FLOW-CONDITION.DESCRIPTION: The condition of the sequence flow.

SEQUENCE-FLOW-CONDITIONAL.TITLE: Conditional flow
SEQUENCE-FLOW-CONDITIONAL.DESCRIPTION: Define the sequence flow with a condition.

SEQUENCE-FLOW-DEFAULT.TITLE: Default flow
SEQUENCE-FLOW-DEFAULT.DESCRIPTION: Define the sequence flow as default.

SIGNAL-DEFINITIONS.TITLE: Signal definitions
SIGNAL-DEFINITIONS.DESCRIPTION: Definitions of signals that are used in signal catch and throw events in the process.

MESSAGE-DEFINITIONS.TITLE: Message definitions
MESSAGE-DEFINITIONS.DESCRIPTION: Definitions of messages that are used in message catch and throw events in the process.

TEXT-ANNOTATION-TEXT.TITLE: Text
TEXT-ANNOTATION-TEXT.DESCRIPTION: The text of the text annotation.

TIMER-CYCLE.TITLE: Time cycle (e.g. R3/PT10H)
TIMER-CYCLE.DESCRIPTION: Define the timer with a ISO-8601 cycle.

TIMER-DATE.TITLE: Time date in ISO-8601
TIMER-DATE.DESCRIPTION: Define the timer with a ISO-8601 date definition.

TIMER-DURATION.TITLE: Time duration (e.g. PT5M)
TIMER-DURATION.DESCRIPTION: Define the timer with a ISO-8601 duration.

USERTASK-ASSIGNMENT.TITLE: Assignment
USERTASK-ASSIGNMENT.DESCRIPTION: Assignment definition for the user task.

USERTASK-DUEDATE.TITLE: Due date
USERTASK-DUEDATE.DESCRIPTION: Due date of the user task.

USERTASK-SEND-EMAIL.TITLE: Allow email notifications
USERTASK-SEND-EMAIL.DESCRIPTION: Allow the system to notify the assignee when a task is assigned.

TOOLBAR.ACTION.BENDPOINT.REMOVE: 为选定的流程连线删除弯曲点
